Message: Please tell me how to make a complaint on one of your hotels; my wife and have stayed in quite a few over the last  years as we traveled to see our children, but this last event will probably be our last with Econolodge Econolodge Lodge, Lookout Mountain, TN; Reservation number  for Friday /26. When we arrived we were greeted by the attendant/ mgr and given a room. WE had requested ground floor(we are senior adults) of course he said none available; we had made our reservation over a week earlier. Made our way to the rd floor couldn't get in our room,  get in our room, had to go back down stairs to get him to give us another key, he even went up to help. Got in our room, very musty smelling, TV wouldn't work, except manually; went back down stairs because he wouldn't answer the phone. I told him we were not happy and concerned about having to constantly come find him, he advised he was tired of me complaining, very rude and disrespectful the whole time, finally got him to issue a refund and we went to another hotel closer  to Chattanooga. This will probably be our last stay with Choice Hotels if this disrespect is what we have to deal with. Rick McDaniel

Message:
I've never felt more scared to stay in a hotel.  Not only was the housekeeper still cleaning the room at pm when my check in time was at  there was a man smoking weed on the balcony.  I told the manager I didn't feel safe.  She said because I used the room As a woman by herself this is not a safe hotel.  My husband told me to leave and get another hote.l   in Thomson Georgia is disgusting and scary.  Don't stay here!  your econo lodge in Thomson Georgia is disgusting and scary.  I felt so unsafe that I didn't care about my refund.   The hotel is run down and honestly as soon as I saw it I knew I couldn't stay there.  The pictures online made it look nice but that was a clear deception.  The housekeeper looked worn out and possibly on drugs.  I brought my dogs upstairs so I could go down and get my stuff.  Once I was back in the room and for to look around it was just disgusting.  The mini fridge had dents and paint on it.  The bathroom tile in the corner had black stuff that looked disgusting.  I was grossed out.  I decided to leave and on the hallway there was a man smoking weed and he looked scary and I felt very unsafe.  The whole hotel looks dangerous and like it is used for drug dealing and prostitutes.  I told the clerk I was scared to stay there and she said since I had used the room I couldn't have a refund.  I didn't stay in the room more than  minutes.  This hotel should be inspected and someone should come in and do an overhaul. I care more about my safety than any amount of money.  I guess you get what you pay for.  But as a tip I would have someone higher up come and do a walk through of this place because there is no way anyone of you would stay at this dump. I greatly appreciate that.  I know that every state or city has areas that are more prevalent to crime and I learned after the fact that Thomson Georgia has one of the highest crime rates per capita in America.  It's sad to say that most of the hotels in that area will have guest feeling very unsafe.  However I know that when I go back to visit my friend I will stay in Augusta.  I appreciate the points for a stay at another one of your hotels and I'm sure I will be able to use it in the future.  I want to let you know that I am the wife of a police officer and he has taught me to be very aware of my surroundings.  Had we looked up the area he never would have let me stay in Thomson.  I am not currently a member but my phone number is -478-0041 email  and my address  village Creek Lane apt.  
Mt. Pleasant, SC 

Again I appreciate your quick response and I hope that upper management and the owner can work together to improve the quality of the Econo Lodge in Thomson Georgia. Message:
really gonna have to fight the quality inn in gainesville if they dont REFUND ME Hello! I dont have a confirmation number for you because we never received an email and the front desk took the receipt back, but the arrival date was July ,  and the name on the reservation was Terresa Frazier or Emily Frazier, Im not sure exactly which one it ended up under. 

When we called to make the reservation, we specifically asked if the pool was open and were told yes, so we proceeded to make the drive to the hotel. Upon check in, as we made our way to our room, we discovered that the pool was completely drained and unusable, which made us upset because we had specifically asked while making the reservation that morning and had been lied to. 

We returned to the front desk to ask about this, and were told that the pool was closed due to the coronavirus, which we completely understand! But we were still upset at being lied to. The front desk worker offered us a full refund, which we accepted and then left to find another hotel. However, instead of reversing the charge to my card, she double charged my card, so I now have  charges of $113 for a room we didnt even stay in. 

We called back once we discovered this, only to be hung up on several times. We finally got ahold of somebody outside that specific hotel and they tried to call the front desk as well, to no avail. Eventually we were able to connect to the front desk worker who had helped us. She insisted that she had run the refund, that it showed as refunded on her side, and that she would forward us the paperwork showing the refund via email. However, we have yet to receive such an email, and my bank account still shows the two charges, neither of which have been refunded.  The last  of the card are , and the address of the hotel is: 

Quality Inn Gainesville  Medal of Honor Blvd
Gainesville, TX  Okay, thanks. But has the second charge also been refunded? Because they charged me the $113 twice. Also, we havent received any invoice. Which email did it send to? Okay, then Ill definitely contact my bank, because there are two charges on it. 

The email should be

Message: On July th, when I first arrived at the Rodeway Inn in Augusta, GA it was stressed that it was a non smoking establishment and there would be a considerable fee if caught smoking. I am pregnant and do not smoke anyway so that wouldnt be an issue. Upon getting to my room it immediately smelt like smoke and there were ashes on the night tables and carpet. I called to the front desk and they moved me to another room. My husband and I unloaded our things then went to go get pizza and brought it back to the room. While eating the pizza I happened to look in the corner of the room and saw a dead roach carcass. As this was a clear indication this establishment was not up to par with cleanliness and sanitation and being pregnant I did not want to stay any longer and asked for a refund. I was RUDELY told since I had been there several hours (2 hours and most of it was out getting pizza) I would not get a refund. I was also not checked out even though I left and wanted a check out receipt. I was told the system could not check me out until the next day. I am in the United States Air Force and I was staying because my air conditioning went out and would be repaired the next day. I am extremely unsatisfied and this is the second time Choice Hotels have not been up to standards. I called Choice Hotels customer service and all that was done was to file a formal complaint. I feel I should receive a refund or I would like to see the manager on duty that day penalized. I will never stay at a Choice Hotels location ever again because of my poor treatment and I will be informing my unit of said treatment I received and they will inform other service members in the area not to go to this establishment. Until something is done or I am contacted regarding this matter I will take my story to all social media and I will recount my past Choice Hotels experience as well, which I had not complained about and did not leave a review. Hello thank you for responding. The confirmation number was  and the name is Brittany Willing
Summary_T5_1: The Rodeway Inn in Augusta, GA was stressed that it was a non smoking establishment and there would be a considerable fee if caught smoking. Brittany Willings is extremely unsatisfied and this is the second time Choice Hotels have not been up to standards. Willings will never stay at a Choice Hotels location ever again because of my poor treatment.

Message: Hello,  how can I make a formal complaint about a hotel and their manager? We booked our stay through Priceline.  We got to the hotel and it wreaked of smoke.  The place was filthy and the staff was not wearing masks,  as mandated by the Governor of Ohio, due to the Covid  pandemic.  The front staff worker was rude. They tried to charge us extra for our children. We actually inquired about a second room but the worker refused to give us the Priceline price.  He sad Priceline is just trying to get their cut,  repeatedly.  I said we could easily book it on Priceline, but just decided to leave.  We immediately walked out,  without getting a room key and called Priceline to cancel,  literally minutes after booking. Wet did not feel comfortable staying there.  Priceline said they needed to call the hotel,  while I waited.  They got back on the line and said the worker refused to cancel our reservation and that the Priceline agent would have to call the manager in the morning.  I waited until afternoon and hadn't gotten a call back,  so I called Priceline.  The agent called the manager and was told that the manager would not cancel our reservation,  give a refund or make any concessions. I decided to call and speak to the manager and try to explain the situation. I was calm and never raised mmt voice. I was absolutely shocked by the response I received. I explained the situation and was told to hold on,  several times, before he got back on the line and told me, you need to speak to Priceline,  they need to cancel it.  I tried to attempt to tell him Priceline told me that he had to approve the cancellation,  emphasizing that his staff was rude and wasn't obeying the law,  regarding the pandemic. He then hung up on me.  I called him back and he said,  "what do you want me to do?" I said I'd like a full refund. He said no,  Priceline told us not to cancel.  I told them I called Priceline within minutes of booking to cancel and that his staff member refused.  I told him we never even got a room key.  He then began to yell and cuss at me.  I told him I'd report him to corporate for not complying with Covid  protocols.  He then told me "we don't give a damn about Covid  protocol,  we don't give a damn about you! Call the police,  call the governor,  call corporate, we don't give a damn! You're paying! Toy deal with Priceline,  Ideal with Priceline. Do not call me again!" He then hung up on me a second time.  Is this the type of service your hotels provides??? I am appalled! It was Quality Inn Huron,  W Cleveland Rd E, Huron, OH  the manager's name was Chris. The name in the reservation is Elizabeth Ginther.  It may say Libby Ginther. Nothing I can think of
Summary_T5_1: The Covid pandemic wreaked havoc on the hotel and its staff. Priceline's manager refused to cancel our reservation, she says. She calls Priceline to explain the situation.
Summary_T5_2: call corporate if you want us cancel stay hotel worker

Message: I know businesses are going through a hard time. But i think all hotels should have flexible bookings right now. Things change daily during a pandemic and at least credit my account to use at a later date if you cant refund me. Will be avoiding Choice hotels for while  Thank you for offering to review my concern. I have already emailed the contact page and received the answer that I was not able to receive a refund because I wanted to save money and paid in advance. I totally understand I chose to do that. Just seems that other hotels are still flexible with their typical nonrefundable rates due to the pandemic and limited travel. My friend had to cancel her wedding that had a room block at Comfort Inn and Suites in Fremont, Ohio (Beane/Harpring) that was scheduled for /7-8/9 due to travel restrictions where they would be coming from. I had originally booked with the block, but when found out it was cheaper for me as a member to book in advance and also get a king bed instead of two queen beds, we canceled the block room and rebooked with confirmation number . It would be great to have an account credit to use at a later date when I have a reason to travel. But even if nothing can be done for me, I would at least like the room to be released so the hotel isnt waiting for us/someone else could use the room. Thanks.

Message: I'd like to report on my recent stay at a Choice Hotel.  I would contact through the website, where I am a Choices Member, but the site will not recognize my user name or e-mail address.  I attempted to sign up again, but it says my email address is already in use, even while not recognizing it. I spent  of the last  nights at the Comfort Suites in Exton, PA.  This is the hotel chosen by my employer for all employees in this area.  Perhaps no longer, after I speak with them.  Frankly, it's the first time I have spent time at a hotel where I felt unsafe. I'll detail some reasons I felt that way.  (1) there appears to be people living in a car in the parking lot.  Maybe not, but call it what you will.   or  people, laying across the car seats with all four doors open, for hours and hours on end, the car surrounded by the trash they are throwing on the ground. A man getting off the elevator with three luggage carts, totally bereft of luggage.  They were piled with loose bedding, dirty clothing, household supplies, and no less than three slow cookers with crusted dried material all over them.  The man was in no better repair than his belongings.... Torn shirt and dirty torn shorts. Now, in the front of the building, parked directly in front of the lobby, a young man in a car.  Her's parked there, during my stray, /7.  I am staying for work, and left the hotel before am each day.  He was there, in his car, on his phone.  Back at various times for lunch in my room.... he was there.  Back for the night by pm, and he's there.  Always on his phone, and always staring at people coming and going.  What is he there for?  Who can say for sure, but I vote he's a freelance pharmaceutical salesman.  VERY freelance. On the other side of the hotel, there appeared the same woman day after day, near a propped open door.   Sitting, leaning on the wall, wandering, but never far from the door and always dressed haphazardly.  My whole stay, she could be found there perhaps every other time I drove past.  What is she doing?  Again, who can say, but I suspect she is a young lade of negotiable affection working from a hotel room.  Not in a high price bracket either. These little vignettes should illustrate my stay nicely.  Take them for what you will.  As for myself, I'll elect to stay elsewhere when my work requires it, even if it costs more. My name was on the reservation, on behalf of Universal Technical Institute.  I stayed there  nights last week and  nights this week.  The company puts instructors in that hotel often, and there's usually at least one or two staying at any given week day.   Beyond that, I see nothing else that I can say, nor anything you can do for me.  I don't intend to stay there again. I should also mention.... Our admin were under the impression they were a 'corporate account' and were being given discounted rates.  When I gave them screen shots of the rates I, as an individual, could get at any time.... they were somewhat perturbed.  All these years they have been paying MORE than average, not a discounted rate.  and  I have no issues because i do not intend to ever use that hotel again.   I'll assume this was a mindless automatic response programmed by an idiot.  Good luck in your future ventures.
Summary_T5_1: The Comfort Suites in Exton, PA is the hotel chosen by my employer for all employees. Frankly, it's the first time I have spent time at a hotel where I felt unsafe. On the other side of the hotel, there appeared the same woman day after day.
Summary_T5_2: a choice hotel employee leaves behind dirty cars

Message:
Good morning.  I booked and stayed in a quality  inn in Indianapolis Indiana using my points. Unfortunately I was incredibly underwhelmed.  The stay was one of the worst Ive experienced in any choice hotel.  Let start by saying if I had other options I likely would have stayed somewhere else.  When you first walk in from entrance your greeted with a yellow bucket in center of walkway collecting rain water, the elevator was also out of service.  The pool was covered ( one of the reasons we chose this location).   I assume because of the pandemic. Im including pictures to illustrate the issues at this partners location.  Our journey up the rickety Ill maintained stairs we were greeted by several hornets and their nest, I brought this to the managers attention who killed hornets same day.  When we arrived to room we had to force door open after key card surprisingly worked.  The hallways all filled constantly with the smell of marijuana. And cieling tiles missing in spots and/or discoloring from leaks.  All this was noticed before room door was opened.  Once upon entering room we noticed stains on the cover pieces on beds and stains on floor.   The multiple discoloration on Ceilings assuming from leaks again. Multiple cracks in plaster on walls and ants on center table.  Mold/caked on dust found in exhaust and bath foundation was incredibly squishy and caulk joints were cracked so Im sure that will need extensive repair.  I have pictures of more I will include and can explain upon request.  I would say our stay was less then quality We ended up leaving a day early due to the issues what are my options for the third day reimbursement?  We did bring these issues to Pat King the manager and he was apologetic and that the room will go through a Thorough cleaning and offered to put us in a different room.  However he stated that the hotel was fully booked and would have a room available later in day.  We were so put off by the issues stated that we didnt feel comfortable staying in a different room.  Which ended up cutting our trip short because we relied on the paid room for stay on our business trip. Gp-mxh267013  eastman st oshkosh wi 


  Matter not resolved Thank you I do have a follow up question if you guys receive complaints about one of your partners do you send an agent to investigate Only reason I ask is it because Ive had a couple of poor experiences with different choice hotels and I would just like to know that my complaints are going on investigated or unheard
Summary_T5_1: The hotel was incredibly underwhelmed. It was one of the worst Ive experienced in any choice hotel. We ended up leaving a day early due to the issues what are my options for the third day reimbursement?

Message:
Do Not use this company to  book ur hotel. They will not help u at all with customer service if you get frauded by one if their hotels. Im living through a nightmare with them as we speak Liz. I have called at least  times and emailed  times. I was told I would receive a phone call back from a supervisor about fraudulent charged by one of their hotels.

I made a reservation to stay at one of your hotels on July th in Seaside Heights NJ at the Rodeway Inn Island Beach state Park. When we arrived it was deplorable. Nothing like pictured on the website. The rooms were filthy and smelled of smoke. Air conditioners barely worked and had black mold growing on the inside of them. The hallways were filthy and smelled. The windows in the hotel hallways were open with no screens. The only way into the hotel a side entrance that did not lock and anyone could gain access. The beds were queen mattress on full size frames which were actually dangerous. When my wife sat on bed she fell off the side. We were appalled at the condition of this hotel and their websites description and pictures were not representative of the actual disarray of this establishment.  We told the attendant that we were not happy and did not feel safe to stay at the hotel and wanted our reservation cancelled and refunded. He disagreed and then we proceeded to call choice hotels. The person on choice hotels called the establishment and he was argumentative and disrespectful. He refused to cancel our reservation or give us our money back. We WILL NOT pay for the  nights at a hotel we did not stay at and HE DID charge my credit card for all  night two rooms totalling $869.92. Now I was told a supervisor would call the gentleman and take care of it. That has not happened. I have called on the th, the st , TH, TH OF of July and August at. All times nothing was done. We ended up staying at another of their establishments for the  night of July , , , . Now Choice Hotels is are our liaisons to the hotels they represent. We use Choice Hotels for that exact reason. Either he refunds our money or choice hotels refunds our money but someone needs to take care of this injustice. It is unacceptable that a hotel they represent is in such a deplorable condition and that they endorse it. Still nothing has been done.!!!! Our case number is   Choice Hotels i pmd you. No reply Choice Hotels still no reply Still no reply. Honestly as expected from ur company Still no reply Still.  No.  Reply Im not happy with the outcome of this situation in ANY way. Two weeks for a response from anyone? Really. The hotel stole  dollars from me and i get a partial refund of my stolen money and im just supposed to hang my tail and go away? Really? At this point maybe i need to contact a lawyer or the ney york states attorney I have contacted the president of the company, patrick pacious in regards to this situation

Message: Hey there, just a bit of constructive criticism... We just got back from a  vacation out west, which had us staying in the Rodeway in Mitchell SD.  The room itself was nice and the people were good, but being in a wheelchair and coming up to a hotel that is a split level with no hotel is an issue.  They didn't even have a curb cut to get into the office, we had to pull me up over about a ft tall lip on the concrete!  I don't know if you guys have any say in how the branches run, but something really needs done to update this location...(Funny that the weekend we sign in was the th anniversary of the ADA...) not sure of the confirmation # cuz my brother handled the hotel, but it was   S Ohlman St Mitchell SD Brad Beam I know some folks get around the accessibility issue by being "grandfathered" in, but even then things like that should be adjusted, even if an outdoor elevator had to be built on to get in the building..

Message:
As a Frontline nurse and Diamond member, I am very disappointed in the current promotions. The Frontline discount is miniscule at best, and actually higher than the regular member rate and the stay twice and get a free night advertising is very deceiving. Even the hotel staff don't understand it. I am currently at a hotel where the staff told me that I would get the points every rd night, as long as I paid by the day vs the week. I realized today that I have not been getting the points. After having my call dropped twice after long waits, customer service finally answers and explains the ridiculous terms and say that nothing can be done for me. They actually told me to check out and stay somewhere else every other night in order to get the advertised points. I'm in a state far away from home, working an assignment and I'm supposed to pack up and move every other day in order to get the advertised savings? Unbelievable! EDJ5744  Frank Ln. Stafford, TX  
 Choice Hotels I have replied via messenger. Thanks. Leticia Thomas Prince yes it is. I couldn't believe it. It was bad enough having to remember to pay every morning before I left for work, as the front desk told me to do vs for the whole week. Then to find out, it was all pointless and I am not getting the benefits from the promotion anyway ... I accept. Thanks.
Summary_T5_1: Frontline discount is miniscule at best, and higher than the regular member rate. Stay twice and get a free night advertising is very deceiving. Even the hotel staff don't understand it.

Message:
Hello. I hope that this finds its way to the correct individual please view pictures as well.

We arrived for our one night stay in Lubbock, TX (5816 th St, Martin Patel owns) Saturday (August th) evening around :00; we checked in and proceeded to our room (418). We check our rooms before settling in, normally, but especially now with Covid being prevalent. The first problem we found was leftover food in the refrigerator but it didn't stop there. There was a dirty, moldy type substance on the utensil wrapping by the coffee maker, a used, wet, dirty towel on the bathroom counter, and the toilet didn't flush. The front desk individual (who was more concerned with mask wearing than overall cleanliness ) moved us to a new room (406). Awesome! Nope. New room had used dental floss on the floor, hair of some sort (I honestly don't want to know what kind) in the beds, beer cans hidden behind the bed that my curious toddler found and, to top it off? A CONDOM STUCK IN THE ARMCHAIR!

This is unacceptable and unhygienic on a normal basis but even more so during a worldwide pandemic! Had we not needed to travel we wouldn't have but this was unavoidable. 

Please take the time to get back to me with a resolution. We paid $120.00 for this experience which is uncalled for. Thank you for the reply as the hotel manager/owner have not reached out at all. 

Confirmation: 
Hotel Name: Sleep Inn & Suites
Hotel Address:  th St, Lubbock, TX, USA
Date: Saturday, August , 
Name: Shannon A Wright

My husband and I have always enjoyed our stay with Choice hotels but this was truly disappointing. My children were exposed to all of this, which hygiene wise during Covid, is terrifying. I understand the policies in place. It is just a bit disappointing as an individual at said hotel told me because I booked through the Choice website, I have to contact Choice to be given a refund. They have yet to have the manager return my phone calls so it looks like I am stuck. I do appreciate the offer and will be happy to accept, thank you. 

Member ID: SXW09530
Address:  Sendera Crossing, La Vernia, TX 
Email: 
Phone: .914.0953

Message:
I just stayed in the worst hotel Ive EVER stayed in!!! Aug -9,2020. It was over $800 for  nights in Nags Head. I am willing to pay but I should at least feel confident that the hotel is in decent shape and clean. The Comfort Inn S Oceanfront is a DUMP. Im so disappointed. Traveler BEWARE! Confirmation Number: 
We arrived at around :15 pm on Friday with excitement. We had to travel with our little dog so researching pet friendly locations led us here. The location was just perfect. We got in the elevator and it was almost frightening. Its tiny and noisy and was kinda scary. When we got to our floor it was ok. It looked like a low end hotel from . Our room was also pretty much what we expected except it wasnt clean. There was water all around the air conditioner on the floor, the bathroom was run down and dirty. The tub had remnants of the former guest.... the balcony was ok but the rail was rusted and loose. The coffee in the room was old and the creamer packets were solid. When I opened it the cream was not powder but a solid chunk so I went without. The staff was very unhappy. We never asked for anything or complained about anything because they cannot help that the hotel is so run down.  We did ask for a late checkout so we could explore the island a bit longer but they said due to COVID cleaning requirements, it wasnt possible. I almost laughed out loud. I dont doubt the requirements but I very much doubt that they are being done at this hotel. I have never  sent a complaint like this before but I just felt robbed. Thank you for letting me vent. Sandy Hunt  Brock Rd
Chickamauga GA  -785-7852
Can you enroll me in the program, I do not have a rewards number. Thank you. My email is

Message:
I absolutely love being a choice member.  I banked enough points that my  vacation this spring was under  for hotel bills. Since many of the rooms I paid for with points.  Plus the free upgrade because of my member status is awesome.  

Only ever had one issue and that was with a hotel in Waterloo Iowa.  It was dark smelly and the door didnt shut right. You could see where it had been kicked in.  

Otherwise every other hotel in the choice chain has been great that I have stayed in.

The Cambria in Rapid City SD has been the % best one out of all so far.    Candace Aufrere thats what do not disturb signs are for.  I stayed at a comfort in for a month due to work and never once was housekeeping an issue. If my sign was up they left me alone. If it wasnt they would knock and ask politely if I needed my room cleaned or any towels.
Summary_T5_1: The Cambria in Rapid City SD has been the % best one out of all so far. If my sign was up they would knock and ask politely if I needed my room cleaned or any towels.

Message: Still waiting for a response from your Customer Relations regarding the bedbug I found on me this morning after spending the night at your Clackamas OR Clarion Hotel.  Day , still no response. Confirmation number:  Date of arrival - Aug , name on the reservation is Amy Chastain. Spent one night, I woke up and went to the bathroom where a bedbug fell off of me. I put it in a paper cup and turned it into the front desk when I checked out. If it wasn't reported I'd say check your security footage of the front desk for the morning of the  at am-ish. Didn't bother to take a shower because I was so disgusted, just wanted to get away from that nasty room. Ended up paying for a shower at a truck stop. What you are saying is that we must go out of our way to be compensated for your failure to provide a clean accommodation. We are not members nor do we intend to become so; in the future we will simply stay elsewhere. This is disappointing, as the Clackamas Clarion is a convenient location to stay at when visiting our son and granddaughter, and the price was quite reasonable. C'est la vie. I discussed the matter with my wife and since she already has an account we've decided to accept your offer. The account number is  AXC254814 and the name is Amy Chastain. I would like to thank you for the time and effort you have made in this matter. We tried multiple ways of contacting Choice Hotels, and you were the most responsive as well as the most professional. My wife was contacted by the hotel itself and it was implied that I wasn't being honest about the situation. I also only today finally received a response via email. So your approach is certainly appreciated. I can't say for certain whether or not we'll ever stay at a Choice Hotel again (we've already made reservations over Christmas at a Marriott), but there was no chance prior to your attention to this matter. Thanks again. Nothing added to my wife's account; I'm left to believe that your offer was nothing more than a PR ploy. Live and learn. Amy Chastain,  W Providence Ave Spokane WA -2252,  -961-2548

Message:
Worse hotel!!! Choice Hotels Jeremiah I have no idea how to send a private message. I would love to explain my horrible experience at this hotel!! Let me start by saying that when I travel it I always stay at choice hotels. This particular stay was on Saturday June ,  under the name Stephanie Simpson. The desk staff was great during check in. I was traveling with my support animal and even though I don't have to I reserved a pet room. When I entered the room I noticed an odor but was hoping my senses were just being sensitive. I was tired from being on the road all day so by the time I got my stuff moved in the room and the smell didn't go away I was tired so I was just going to deal with it. I do want to say that the bed and bathroom were clean or I would have changed my room immediately. I noticed a man cleaning rooms a few doors down and told him about the smell in the room and asked if he had anything I could spray mainly on the carpet but also on the chair, curtains (which also had burn holes in them) and the wood closet thing smelled like something died in it. He said he was sorry and gave me something so I sprayed the room and took my dog for a walk. The lady in the room next door was complaining about the smell in her room when she heard me talking with the cleaning crew. When I got back the smell was still so bad it made me sick to my stomach. So I decided to take care of it myself. So I drove to Walmart and got a can of extra strength animal oder febreeze and after spraying the room at least  times the smell went away enough to be comfortable in the room. I have stayed in many many pet rooms and I understand they aren't necessarily as nice as non pet rooms. That some people aren't as diligent about making sure their pet doesn't mess up or smell up a hotel room as I am. This room should not have been used until it could have been cleaned properly including shampooing the carpet and the nasty smell removed. We pay more money for a pet room but shouldn't get room of less quality because you travel with a pet. I don't know if it was a lapse in communication between the cleaning staff and the front desk. The cleaning staff was still very busy cleaning rooms in the evening when I arrived. I understand the financial consequences of closing a room but it couldn't be as severe as loosing a long time loyal customer. When I checked out of my room the next morning my intention was to talk to the front desk about my stay. But...after standing and waiting for several minutes waiting for someone to come back to the desk I gave up because I needed to get back on the road for another long travel day. There are less expensive hotels chains but I got tired of staying in crappy hotels just to save money so I started staying at  Choice hotels. I am hoping that I will never come across another hotel with rooms this bad but if I do I will be looking for another chain to give my business to. 
Stephanie Simpson Comfort Inn  Elks Dr. Dickinson, ND  my stay was Friday July -  the reservation was under Stephanie Simpson I appreciate your offer but with all due respect  points won't even get me a free night at a low end choice hotel. The awful hotel I complained about is ,000 choice privledges points a night. So anything less than that will not rectify this situation. SMS05115 Stephanie Simpson  SW Wildwood Rd Port Orchard, WA

Just spoke with someone claiming to be Byron Kelly of Atlanta on Phar Rd and will be taking my issue to court He is the general manager of the establishment on Phar Rd And he hung up and has refused to pay back the $97.35 refund. I will be calling corporate. And will be calling Shepherds center since I was in need of a hotel while my son was undergoing therapy after being hit by a car. I will make sure shepherd's center knows how their patients family members are treated and will be giving this matter plenty of online publicity. Disgusting behavior by someone who is supposed to be a general manager of one of your hotels. I called at pm tonight and he was disgusting lied and was rude then hung up on me and told me I could get a lawyer and he didn't care to go right ahead. He is a disgrace to your company. I travel with my mother all over the world on many trips and will never set foot in a hotel associated with your brand as long as you have people like Byron Kelly working for you. There was an attempt to call twice to cancel the reservation because of feeling unsafe in the parking lot on Phar Rd in Atlanta due to  people walking through and not lit properly and the phone qas unanswered We have proof with phone records we fully intend to take to court. And all of this disgusting display of behavior over $97? This is the kind of behavior you all tolerate? Absolutely unacceptable. We will be hiring an attorney and will let everyone know know about this rude person and your hotel chain and how it is run. He said he would not refund and we did not try and call and that's fine he will look like an idiot when he has to go to court because we have the time date stamp we called and nobody answered the phone. The reference number is  The minimal amt was $97.35 and rather than refund that the guy I spoke with who claimed to be Byron Kelly was the same guy who has hung up on me now twice. I recorded the last conversation where he constantly interrupted me stating I could hire a lawyer to get our money back which we will if this isn't resolved quickly. I would think a "general manager" would be smart enough to know when I say I have phone records that we tried to call and cancel he basically wrote in the letter we didn't call which he is calling me a liar. We called twice with  to  min in between to cancel. The reservation was an emergency due to my son being transferred to Shepherds center for being hit by a car and that's why it wasn't a reservation made hrs in advance. Really curious if who hung up on me twice was actually Byron Kelly on Aug th or is he posing as him because in the letter it states the staff member made him aware. Phone records the night of Aug th of the male I spoke to needs to be addressed who that is. They are a pathetic excuse for hospitality. He hung up on me twice on different days. Definitely same guy. Recognized voice. I was told the hotel was reprimanded by customer service and they would refund our money promptly. I think this guy on Pharr road in Atlanta is mad and is refusing to refund because he's in simplest terms a jerk. My family has a lawyer on retainer and we will be pursuing this in court and there will be plenty of publicity about this situation if this matter is not solved immediately. I've travelled many places all over the world and never been treated so nastily. I do not want credit points. I want his credit card to be refunded.
Thank you for your quick action to this matter. Look forward to hearing from you. What's funny is in this letter he is so nice but the recording I have of the phone conversation is a different story.

Hello!  I'm really hoping you can help me.  I stayed with Comfort Suites in Sioux Falls SD.  When checking into the hotel, I let them know that I had issues changing my reservation on check out date.  I was using a free night on my last night in town.  Upon check out, they informed me I was charged the full amount at check in and I'd get a credit for the change.  She gave me the receipt and didn't think much more. I didn't receive the full credit so I emailed w/o a response.  I then called and talked to Angela who said she was the manager.  I explained I didn't get the full credit, she then informed me that I wouldn't because I booked under a % discount if staying for  nights.  My issue is they didn't tell me that and they should have not given me the receipt with the cost if that was the case.  I did offer to cancel the reservation and rebook at check in but they said no, they would change the date which didn't happen either. If I would have cancelle and rebooked, I'd have paid less and I tried telling her that but she told me what the website tells me on price doesn't concern her.  I told her I had the receipt and was pretty much told it was my prerogative to dispute it with the credit card company which is already been done.  I can't express how disappointing in the customer service and her non caring attitude is a shame  I'd like to pay what my actual receipt says.  Are you able to help?  Thank you...Julie Drake I attached my receipt with all the information listed. Thank you for any help in this. Comfort Suites  S Carolyn Ave
Sioux Falls SD 
Reservation was under me, Julie Drake. Check in date /13-8/16. Account number is . I'm actually really disappointed in this and in the managers response. I take responsibility in not realizing there was a special rate but it's too bad the hotel didn't take responsibility in mentioning that to the customer at check out and actually handing the customer the correct copy of the bill.  It's also disappointing that I was charged $339.39 but if I would have actually cancelled and rebooked for the exact three days I would have paid $312.12...I shouldn't have assumed they hotel to actually honor that either. I took a screen shot of price of I would have as I like to know what I'm being charged without surprises.  I'm sorry to hear that they aren't willing to honor the price the gave me in the bill or the price I works have gotten if I'd have rebooked for the exact same days... The hotel is a business, they are there to make money.

Message:
Not real happy with these folks. 
Only offered King Rooms with showers. If you want a tub youll have to go in a double room and pay extra!  And we are Choice Members. Front desk belligerent. 
Housekeeper saved us. God Bless her. She could tell i was in pain. Just got out of hospital Thursday. Wont be staying here ever again.  When we arrived at Sleep Inn in Meridian - reservations as Choice members - the front desk clerk was aggravated that she had to step away from doing laundry to help check us in after we rang the bell several times.  other couples came in and were waiting with us during that time as well. Not friendly or welcoming at all. Made us feel guilty for showing up. 
After fussing about having to do it all, we were checked in and went to the third floor to our king room. When we opened the door we discovered it had a shower - not a tub/shower combo. There was a housekeeper working the area who heard our conversation that I needed to go back down and get a king room with the tub. I had just gotten out of the hospital  days earlier and needed a hot soak. The housekeeper called down to the front desk to make the exchange for us. The front desk clerk said there was no such thing. That all king rooms only had showers. If I wanted a tub, I would have to pay extra and take a double room. I said Im not paying extra for just getting the tub/shower that I understood came with my reservation. Front desk hung up. Housekeeper was kind enough to call back and tell her we needed some help. By this time Im almost in tears from the pain of standing and waiting downstairs and now upstairs.  That sweet housekeeper would not give up. She called the third time and was able to convince her to let us have a room across the hall from the first one. Then she came into the room with us to make sure everything was sanitized and everything was there and in order- apologizing for the mixup. Front desk lady had no explanations or apology or accommodation. 
I want to commend the strength of my ally the housekeeper. But front desk needs some lessons in customer service and hospitality. 
Chose this property for the good TripAdvisor rating. Thats probably going to change after I register my review. 
Will not be choosing any other Choice properties. Switched over to Wyndham for the rest of our week-long trip. 
Good luck with getting some hospitality staff trained here.
Summary_T5_1: Front desk clerk aggravated that she had to step away from doing laundry to help check us in after we rang the bell several times. When we opened the door to our king room, when we opened the door we discovered it had a shower - not a tub/shower combo. The front desk clerk said there was no such thing. If you wanted a tub, I would have to pay extra and take a double room.
Summary_T5_2: front desk lady saves us stayed late checkin

Surfbreak Oceanfront in VA Beach certain is not living up to this......I have never seen a hotel this dirty. The hallways on every floor look like they havent been vacuumed in years.  There is all sorts of trash and food and cigarette butts on the floors of all the hallways.  Literally disgusting.  We came to our room, which was actually pretty clean, but there were not enough towels, no wash cloths or soap for our hands.  When we asked at the front desk, they said they didnt have any and didnt know when we would get some.  How are we supposed to shower without towels and wash cloths?  Also this is supposed to be a smoke free facility, but there are cigarette butts in the hallways and a strong smell of smoke/marijuana.  Also cigarette butts around the pool. Choice Hotels I have lots of photos. Hi!  Unfortunately nothing has been resolved.  The staff was very unresponsive.  I was not even greeted at the front desk when I came in....the girl just stared at me so I told her I was there to check in.  The room was pretty decent but the rest was absolutely disgusting.  The hallways of every floor were covered in trash and food and cigarette butts. There was an awful smell.  There were the same pieces of trash in the main lobby floor and a pile of sand from the time we checked in til the time we checked out.  It seemed like none of the staff was trained in customer service and did not care at all.  Im honestly surprised this hotel has not been shut down by the health department.  I felt ill for a day after checking out.  I have never seen such a dirty hotel, and Ive stayed in a lot!    We stayed at Surfbreak Oceanfront in VA Beach.  Confirmation #5078940320 on September st. Message: We are currently at one of your locations in North Carolina. I traveled from Virginia to visit my boyfriend working out of town. The first room we found a spoon in a drawer with drug paraphernalia on it and a bag of trash along with used sheets. We washed our hands and left. We asked to be moved. After the night manager checked it out she moved us. The second room was even worse. Bed sheets piled on both beds and it smelled like a bottle of perfume had been poured out. We then went back to the manager to get a refund and was told we could not because we washed our hands in the first room. This is crazy! With COVID being still being a issue why could we not get a clean room at your establishment??? I will be sharing this if we do not get our refund tonight. Your night manager was every bit of the rudest manager Ive ever come across. We are currently waiting on police to get here to see if they can help us get a refund. Unbelievable i hope yall get shut down Hello Joe. I dont have a confirmation number. That might have been on the deposit slip we have back to Christi the night manager. It was Saturday night into Sunday morning it happened. I think we arrived there about pm and when all was said and done it was about am Sunday morning. I messaged you all right after the incident. Also name on the reservation was Christopher Mullen and Heather Brown This is the hotel We didnt use a card we paid cash. She gave us a refund after two hours of dealing with her attitude. She gave us the money along with the letter never to return to that location.

Message:
About  weeks ago my mother sent the following to Corporate HQ of Choice Hotels.  She received a response saying it would be forwarded to the Advanced Support Team.  Unfortunately we have not heard anything since.  Here is the message that was originally sent.  We had reservations for  rooms at the Comfort Inn,  N. Kinser Pike Bloomington, IN   from May th thru May th , the weekend of the Indiana University graduation. The reservations were made May ,  and a check in the amount of $1,653.12 was sent to secure the rooms. 

Unfortunately, the graduation was canceled due to the worldwide Covid Virus Pandemic.  I called to cancel our reservations at the Comfort Inn the day Indiana University canceled graduation due to restrictions imposed by the state of Indiana.

Our original reservation was made with Michael Gebhardt, the general manager at the time.  When I canceled the reservations I spoke with John Green who had replaced Michael Gebhardt, who assured me that I would receive a full refund of my payment but that it could take a few months.

 

 On June , , I received a letter ( see attachment) from Dawn Crawford, the present General Manager who replaced John Green, stating no refunds would be issued, but I would have $1,653.12 credit to be used the Comfort Inn  at  N. Kinser Pike. Upon receipt of this letter I called Ms Crawford who gave me the number for the CCO/owner, Ken Edwards.  I have called Mr. Edwards, who has had our money, plus the money from all the other families who were coming to celebrate graduates for over a year at this point, and left  several messages. I have never received a return call.   

We live in Maryland.  We have no plans to travel to Bloomington at any time.  We are retirees and were coming to Bloomington for our grandaughter's graduation.  The airlines gave us a full refund, as did the restaurants in Bloomington.

We have stayed in Comfort Inns many times when we were traveling.  I have always found the staff to be helpful and knowledgeable, the rooms to be comfortable and clean.

I feel this incident is not only unfair to us, but reflects poorly on the Choice Hotels family, specifically the Bloomington Comfort Inn. 

I hope you can help us resolve this most upsetting situation and let me know when my refund will be sent. I just saw an article in the New York Times about this issue with frachises and how corporate is trying to help at places like Hilton.  I hope you are able to help as well.  Thnak you! Cindy Oser was the name on the reservation. Let me see if I can get you a reservation number. Thank you. The reservation may have been made under Irnest or Irnie Oser. As noted by your other customer service rep the cancellation  is in the system so you should have access to it. We did not provide the reservation number earlier as I am not sure I have it. I will look. Thank you for your help. Hope this gives you what you need. Hi.  Is what I sent you what you need to look into this and get the refund moving forward?  Thank you! Thank you!
Summary_T5_1: The Comfort Inn at N. Kinser Pike Bloomington, IN was booked for graduation. A check in the amount of $1,653.12 was sent to secure the rooms. Indiana University's graduation was canceled due to the worldwide Covid Virus Pandemic.

Stayed at the Comfort Inn & Suites in Independence, Kansas on September , .  Upon check in, we weren't told that they wouldn't be serving any breakfast as they were out of food.  REALLY!  There was only one wash cloth with the other towels.  One wash cloth for two people!  Hmmm, I don't think so!  Luckily, I had a wash cloth in my suitcase.  Not even any bath soaps in the room.  When we checked out, the lady at the desk said people usually pack their own towels and wash cloths.  When did that start!  Paid enough for the room anyway!  All at a cost of $113.07.  I think we should 
get back a % discount?  What do you think choicehotels.com?

Message:
Mt Juliet Quality Inn & Suites, absolute worst motel ever stayed at in my life! Dirty, rooms were dirty...I didn't touch anything without a bacterial wipe from my purse it was so bad including elevator buttons and wore my shoes except in bed but if I had a huge zip lock bag or rain coat to slide into bc the sheets were also disgusting. Huge waste if money...am shocked that Choice hotels have such a property in the time of Covid being so filthy. But the front desk clerk at check out smiled, seemed friendly.   As requested, a DM regarding my recent unpleasant stay. See info below. I was sent a survey earlier in the week, routine survey I think, I completed it and earlier today received an email from the property GM to say sorry. I replied to him but the email bounced back as undeliverable though it appeared to be his direct email (first name Amit). I stayed across the street last yr for a family funeral at the Hampton, much more expensive but clean and currently being furloughed due to Covid (Waffle House Corp/CEO's Office), yes...I was being careful about spending and safety but the value for the lower price was not worth it  and typically, in my job...I coordinate events, meetings and travel for my team. I would have been mortified if I had selected a motel that filthy no matter who paid the bill but especially my limited funds having to see family for an emergency and they all cringed when they heard where I stayed. So please clean it up!!! 

Conf # 
Quality Inn & Suites,  Hershel Drive, Mt. Juliet, TN , .4 - .5 (checked in approx midnight, checked out approx am). 

Thank you for the timely response.

Veronica Chaffin Choice Hotels thank you...I sent a DM with the requested info. Thank you for your concerned response.  Hi Liz - I understand independently operated but assumed a certain standard in order to have the Choice brand connected to the property. Especially during Covid but again, under any circumstances...not clean. I thank you for the offer. That is fine. My complaint was to make Choice aware, not for anything free or comp'd. However, I will accept the points to use for a future stay. 

 	
Open this message to review your booking details.	View In Web
 
 	
Choice Privileges	
Veronica's Account: #VXC110614
Membership Level: Member
Veronica Chaffin  AZTEC Rd, C
Atlanta, GA 
 .353.1106
Again, thank you for the timely reply and concern for the issue. Thank you!
Summary_T5_1: Veronica Chaffin was staying at the Quality Inn & Suites in Mt. Juliet, TN. The motel was dirty and filthy. She sent a DM to the property GM but it bounced back as undeliverable.

Message:
Tried to stay at a choice hotel in port richey FL this past weekend... st a comfort inn on the phone they said the pets would be fine but then mins later when we arrived the guy at desk told me my dog was too big n then they put a comment on the webpage that i came in and didnt like pet policy so i "stormed off" (yes at am i was pissed that the person at the desk is tellin me i cant stay after i had called st) and he marked me as a no show and charged me for the reservation anyways...

Then a rodeway in that the guy at the desk asked me for CASH pet fee..  tried to leave it off the receipt and i told him i needed a receipt.. took him mins to give me a receipt that included pet fee.. only to be CHARGED AGAIN on my card in the morning the $30 pet fee...
 mins on hold yesterday with the customer relations before i gave up and figured ill try again later today...

OVERCHARGED damn near $100 for "choice" hotels Hotel : quality inn & suites... called the hotel in the evening to ask pet policy.. was told they had pet friendly rooms available and it was $25/night for pets.. booked it later that night and when we went to check in at am my dog was in the car barking... the older man at the desk asked what kind of dogs i had (a pit/lab mix and a plott hound puppy) he then told me my mix was too big to stay there and "looked vicious" . I told him that when we called nobody said anything about a size prohibition (he is lbs) and hes not vicious.. he told me "thats my pet policy whether you like it or not i have final say"... so i told him cancel us then n walked out because i cant not bring my dog in... he put in the notes that "he told me the pet policy and i didnt like it so i stormed off and hes marking me as a no show"... i was charged for that room Hotel :Rodeway Inn.. we stayed here the next night,the guy at the desk told me the pet fee had to be cash.. so i paid cash.. then he left it off the receipt.. i asked for a receipt n he said i didnt need it, but i demanded he produce a receipt for the pet fee... mins later he gave me a receipt for the pet fee...they charged my card in the morning the pet fee ontop of the cash i paid.. took days for my bank to reverse their double charge for the pet fee..  had i not asked for a receipt id have been screwed on that double charge... also there were roaches in the room... I definitely messaged you guys and got no response Ok How yall gunna say youve reached out but not gotten a response when i messaged u times already n yall ignore every message  Hotel : quality inn & suites... called the hotel in the evening to ask pet policy.. was told they had pet friendly rooms available and it was $25/night for pets.. booked it later that night and when we went to check in at am my dog was in the car barking... the older man at the desk asked what kind of dogs i had (a pit/lab mix and a plott hound puppy) he then told me my mix was too big to stay there and "looked vicious" . I told him that when we called nobody said anything about a size prohibition (he is lbs) and hes not vicious.. he told me "thats my pet policy whether you like it or not i have final say"... so i told him cancel us then n walked out because i cant not bring my dog in... he put in the notes that "he told me the pet policy and i didnt like it so i stormed off and hes marking me as a no show"... i was charged for that room Hotel :Rodeway Inn.. we stayed here the next night,the guy at the desk told me the pet fee had to be cash.. so i paid cash.. then he left it off the receipt.. i asked for a receipt n he said i didnt need it, but i demanded he produce a receipt for the pet fee... mins later he gave me a receipt for the pet fee...they charged my card in the morning the pet fee ontop of the cash i paid.. took days for my bank to reverse their double charge for the pet fee..  had i not asked for a receipt id have been screwed on that double charge... also there were roaches in the room... Quality Inn  US Hwy  N, New Port Richey, FL 
Katie Duffy  (i dont see confirmation number just membership # n account# this is account #) /4 Rodeway Inn Port Richey North,  US-19, Port Richey, FL 
Katie duffy  /5

Message: I had to cancel a room because of COVID. It took about  phone calls before anyone could properly process my refund. It was supposedly processed on /31/20. I was told to wait  business days for the refund to clear my bank. That never happened. I spoke with my bank and they don't have anything regarding the refund. I talked to various people with your customer service today and was finally told to call the hotel directly. I called about  times and no answer. I have no refund, no hotel room and now I am convinced that the hotel is closed and never intended to return my money. What are you going to do to make this right? I had to cancel a hotel room at the Comfort In and Suites Kansas City Downtown due to COVID on May th and still don't have my refund. I have spoken with various people in your customer service since then and finally got someone to "confirm" my refund on /31/20. He said I need to wait  days for the refund to clear my bank. It has been well over  business days and my bank has no record of this refund. Today I was told that Choice can no longer help me and that I need to speak directly with the hotel. I called the hotel multiple times and no one answered. I am getting the impression that the hotel is closed (as it was during my intended stay but I was never contacted) and never intended to return my money. Message: We were looking for a place to stay for tonight (9/13/20) in Rapid City SD. Based on the fact that the Choice Hotels website says they are cat friendly and Hotels.com states that they are pet friendly, we booked a night at Clarion Inn, and attempted to check in about -10 minutes later. Clarion Inn refused our reservation because they dont allow cats, only dogs. They apologized for the inconvenience and told us that Hotels.com could refund us. I called Hotels.com and the customer service rep called Clarion Inn to verify my story. She stated that, yes they indeed refused to allow us to stay but, due to their strict no refunds policy they wouldnt allow Hotels.com to refund us because we cancelled our reservation. I am absolutely appalled at the very poor customer service that Choice Hotels allowed the Clarion Inn to provide. We did NOT cancel our reservation, we were REFUSED a room. The customer service rep at Hotels.com was very apologetic and said her hands were tied, and the only way that I could get a refund would be to dispute the charge with my bank.  Thank you for replying to my comment. Heres a screenshot of the email reservation. Name on the reservation is Kami Gamlem

Message: Be careful which one you go to! The manager named Jacky at Econolodge Crystal Coast located in Morehead City, NC (252)247-2940 stole approximately $400 from the credit card of my elderly disabled military veteran father and totally refused to give it back. When confronted about it she was extremly rude and said it wasn't her problem. You can call the included number and tell them how you feel about doing stuff like this. Econolodge Morehead City NC specifically the manager Jacky STOLE approximately  $400 from my elderly, disabled military veteran father's credit card and totally refused to refund it back to him. When confronted about it she simply displayed a rude attitude about it. They are very rude and don't care whatsoever how they treat people. The number is listed here if you want to tell them how you feel about doing people like this (252)247-2940. During a stay at Econolodge Morehead City NC, the manager Jacky STOLE approximately  $400 from my elderly, disabled military veteran father's credit card and totally refused to refund it back to him. When confronted about it she simply displayed a rude attitude about it. They are very rude and don't care whatsoever how they treat people. Go elsewhere. The overcharges on my fathers credit card was made by the manager named Jacky at the Econolodge located in Morehead City NC. It has been about  years now. My entire family used to stay there quite often. We visit the area a lot because I am a commercial fisherman and also film catching certain species with a couple of different television networks. During this particular visit it my  year old daughter and myself and we used my father's credit card which we often do. Once the CC statement came in my father showed me the extra charges on the card. I contacted Jackie at the motel and she said it was because it was reported that either my  year old daughter or myself was smoking in the room. Nobody in my entire family smokes or uses any tobacco products and we never have because of obvious health risks. I pointed that fact out to her and her reply was that it must have been my  year old daughter. We have stayed in the motel several times since this happened. This past week my wife, my daughter, and myself went to get a room there for several days because I had to film a trailer for the upcoming Tuna season. Jackie approached me complaining about an online review I left about my experience  years ago and told me that we wasn't welcome in any of (her) businesses anymore. I reminded her that she is simply a manager and didn't own any of the motels she worked for. Her reply was that the owners was none of my business and far as I'm concerned she was the top of the ladder. Her attitude is horrible. Just look at the online reviews peop have left. We have been staying there for a really long time so I know and have seen how she is and her rudeness. I have actually been thinking of paying for and taking out a newspaper article explaining some of this and possibly even bringing some of it out during filming. The way she has done my father isn't right. The was she denied my family and myself simply because she didn't like my review was not only wrong and rude, but it's discrimination against us. Choice Hotels done. My legal name is Thomas Adkins. My father's name is Joseph Adkins.

When confronted about it she was extremly rude and said it wasn't her problem. You can call the included number and tell them how you feel about doing stuff like this.

Message:
Terrible customer service Terrible customer service Hi, thanks for responding to my comment. The matter was not resolved... i will write back with more info after my work hour, is it ok? Hi there, so, Im going to explain what happened and why I said that the customer service was terrible.
On September th I did a reservation through Trip.com for the Comfort Inn & Suites Miami International Airport hotel. I was going to stay only for one night before my flight to Brazil, September th, and I knew that my fare was without refunds, but I had no intention to change my plans. September th, :58 AM (EDT) my reservation was confirmed by the Hotel and at :11 AM (EDT) I got and email from LATAM saying that my flight (September th) was canceled. I contacted LATAM and they gave me the option to fly one day before, September th and I accepted. So, at :41 AM (EDT) Ive contacted Trip.com to see if there was anything that they could do to help me with the hotel. A person called Victoria told me that if the hotel accepts, I would be able to cancel my reservation. So she contacted the hotel and at the st contact, she was unable to talk to anyone, on the nd contact after a the hotel putting her on hold, they hang up on her and on her rd try and the manager rejected the refund. After that I tried to contact the hotel several times without success, no one was answering the phone, so, I gave up.
I was very disappointed because of all that, in the middle of a pandemic that a lot of flights are getting canceled and plans are changing outside of our control, I was just trying to get back to my family, had all this cancelation problems and the manager didn't have the good will to help or to give me a chance to cancel my reservation that was confirmed  minutes before my flight was canceled And for what,  dollars? Surely this money would not be missed for him as it did for me.
I have proof of all that So, this is not just someone trying to get some advantage of something Its just something that make you trust or not on a brand.
Thanks for your time and attention. Just texted you guys The name on the reservation is Luiz C Peck Garrido This was the time when I got the confirmation and when I received the email saying that my flight was canceled Also, because of the change, I also have the proof that I had to flight on th and not on the th like it was planned
Summary_T5_1: LATAM canceled my reservation for the Comfort Inn & Suites Miami International Airport hotel on September 8. I tried to contact the hotel several times without success, no one was answering the phone and on her rd try, no one was answering the phone. The manager said that if the hotel accepts, I would be able to cancel my reservation.
Summary_T5_2: great customer service iââll write back later

Message: Horrible company! I was staying at the comfort inn for work when Hurricane Sally hit, it prolonged me being able to move into my home I just got in Pensacola for my new job. So i was having to stay there longer but after the hurricane they said that I couldn't stay there because I was not the person on the card (My company paid for my stay) He said I needed to leave now, mind you I was still not able to move into my home because of damages from Sally I had no where to go, My company called later and they were charging triple the rates, taking advantage of people in a crisis who suffered damages to their home or who simply wanted a hot shower we were without power for  days. I had to drive all the way back to my home in Alabama and am missing work because they are money hungry and price gouging! My company spends thousands and thousands of dollars putting their employees in their hotels work business trips. That will no longer happen after the humiliation they put me through!

Maintenance didnt fix it nor did he let me know he couldnt fix it so I went from Monday til Monday without a working tv. All while being told maintenance came by but he couldnt fix it. I know it may seem like something trivial, but when you check into a weekly hotel you expect to be able to come in, shower, lay down and watch tv. I didnt get the problem fixed until Monday the last day of this reservation even though I extended it for another week. At that point I was moved to the other room. Management said there wasnt anything she could do for the inconvenience and I dont feel thats right at all. Id like somebody to address this if possible. Message:
Hello. We recently booked a -night stay at Westport, MO (MO608) for our daughters wedding. We paid $442.62 for the entire stay and are requesting a partial refund.

We had this booked before the COVID pandemic, so the rate wasnt unreasonable, considering we thought we would be able to swim, eat hot breakfast, etc. 

What we received was a musty-smelling room, a toilet that barely flushed, stained comforter, lukewarm shower water, and no amenities.
We also noticed the room rates advertised on the WiFi announcement were $30 less per night. 

We asked the front desk about adjusting the rates, and they stated they couldnt do anything about it. 

Please help!

Confirmation#  
My wifes Choice Membership# JAN07194 Sent you a PM this morning and am patiently awaiting a response... Jendy, 
The price difference alone between our stay and what the rates should have been was $129.60. 
That price difference doesnt include the dissatisfaction resulting from the above concerns. 
We appreciate your offer, but we dont feel that it fully compensates us for the price difference, grievances, and lack of on site customer service. 
Were very reasonable people, but we firmly believe there should be more compensation than a partial nights stay. 

Please advise.

Thank you, 
-Kevin
Summary_T5_1: We paid $442.62 for the entire stay and are requesting a partial refund. The room rates advertised on the WiFi announcement were $30 less per night. We asked the front desk about adjusting the rates, and they stated they couldnt do anything about it.

Message: Watch the one in Meridian Mississippi.  I stopped for a room yesterday hurricane evacuee at that. I ask her if they was pet friendly like most comfort inns are. She told me know and then she told me it would cost me  dollars for my pet to stay. I felt discriminated against cause I am white she was black and very rude. I was not familiar with Mississippi as it was. But my  year old mini schnauzer that dont weigh  pounds is well behaved like the schnauzers are house trained and is like my kid, being I am older person and kids are grown. I was not very pleased with that comfort inn hotel.  I was working my way back home after hurricane delta. I stopped in your meridan comfort inn, next door to sams club basically. i had called and reserved a room on my way to there. lady at the front desk was very rude. i thought well maybe its just me, I am tired and this is the second hurricane I have had to leave my home and my routine for in less than two months. I went in to get room and I asked the lady was you all pet friendly. I stay at Jasper Al. comfort inn all the time and they are very pet friendly. My baby is  years old house trained the works,he is mine and my husbands kid since our kids are grown and we are older with health problems. Anyway the lady told me  no, then she turned around and told me a  dollar fee. I polietly told this rude lady we wouldnt be staying there. you can see the cancellation in my account. Then after she told me it was  fee. I told my husband this lady was rude, first she told me no then she told me .00 fee. I told him I wondered if it was cause I was white and she was black. I have never in my life felt discrimaneted against til I walked into your comfort inn there in Meridan Ms. I came on to Louisiana couldnt find a room then call electric compant for them to tell me they didnt know when our electric would be on. I am not suppose to travel for long hours due to my heart and a pulmonary embolism, but I turned aroiund and went all the way back to Jasper Al. Comfort Inn where they make you feel welcome everyday from the time you walk through their door until you check out and leave. They make you feel at home and it aint just front desk, laundry, and housekeeping also makes you feel that way. Thanks I have choice rewards and it shows in my records the cancellation All I can tell you is it was in Meridan Ms. basically next door to Sams Club. Message: Hi, thank you for reaching out. The booking number is  . Teri was absolutely wonderful to work with and went above and beyond.  One thing I need to address is two erroneous charges.  A few hours after we checked out we saw a charge for $163.88.  We called the hotel and were told that it was for missing items from the room, specifically two pillows.  I advised the staff member that I spoke with that we didnt remove anything from the room. She placed me on hold and checked with housekeeping, when she came back to the call she apologized for the mistake and said that it was a misunderstanding. She said that the money would be immediately refunded. On or around /14 our account was charged again in the amount of $163.88. I spoke with the manager Bob who apologized for the mistaken charge and said that he would be refunding both charges.  I called again today because the charges were still on our account. Bob advised that the refunds were processed on /14 and it would take -10 business days to go through.  I am sure to choice hotels $327.76 isnt a lot of money but this creates major issues for us.  It is interfering with paying bills, getting groceries, etc., and frankly completely unacceptable that we should be made to wait -10 business days for not one but two mistakes we didnt make.  The lack of urgency in this matter and honestly the minimally apologetic nature is disgusting.  Im not expecting grand gestures, but something more than just an oopsie daisy attitude would make this a little better.  I would like to hear from a member of corporate, not Bob at the hotel to get this matter resolved sooner rather than later.  I can be reached at  (443) -3718.                        Thank You, Bethany Dietz

Message:
I complained about one of your hotels and you asked for a private message.

I stayed at a suburban extended stay in Grand Island Nebraska. That was the first one I stayed at. It was clean and comfortable. That is why I chose the same hotel when I came to the Denver area. After publicly making my complaint, I asked some friends in the area. It turns out I just picked the wrong part of town. It's hard to be honest without coming off as rude, but I will do my best. Judging by the clientele, what I have is what I should expect. The staff has been very nice, but they also fit into their surroundings. The rooms seem updated and look nice. The kitchens aren't stocked but I am guessing that stuff walks out frequently.The towels and sheets are pretty gross. I bought new bedding and towels. I'm comfortable.  The price was good and I should expect that there was a trade off. I really don't want to see the staff take any heat. It appears, as I observe more, that they are quality people doing the best with what they are going to have to work with. Maybe corporate could spend a few bucks on new whites and a better washer.
Summary_T5_1: The hotel was clean and comfortable. It's hard to be honest without coming off as rude. But I will do my best.
Summary_T5_2: hotel picks wrong part town says customer complaints

Message: I used to work at a Choice Hotel, Quality Inn in Cadiz, KY owned by Ram Kabir. Not going into too many details, the hotel was in shambles. Message:
Just to let you know:
I stayed at the Clarion Inn & Suites Central I-44 in Tulsa Oklahoma Sunday night  Nov .  I paid over  dollars for a "Military Discounted" room.  I have traveled the world and stayed in hundreds of hotels and I never been in something as bad as this hotel.  For starts I found a very small dead bug on one of the beds.  So I was forced to sleep in my clothes in fear of bedbugs.  Second the room had been smoked in and the smell was extremely strong.  I smoked for  years so I was able to get past the smell, but I am sure most people would be able to.  All of the electrical items in the room were unplugged so I had to move furniture just to get the TV to work.  The toilet paper was positioned so close to the toilet that you could not even sit without knocking off the roller.  All the caulking in the shower had been removed and there was a very large amount of black mold visible.  The curtain had been ripped off the hangers so I had to use a chair to hold the curtain in place to keep it closed.  Add in broken furniture, broken tile and the overall poor quality of everything in this room I assure you that I will never stay in any of your hotels from this point on.  I think I would have been better off sleeping in my car than staying in your hotel.
Thomas Meeker I never got offered a receipt.  Here is the number that showed up on my card  They never offer a receipt so I have no confirmation number, here is the number that was listed on my credit card charge.    I will go out of my way to never stay in any of your hotels.  Good luck. Private message? how via FB Messenger or email?  I got neither...
Summary_T5_1: Thomas Meeker paid over dollars for a "Military Discounted" room at the Clarion Inn & Suites Central I-44 in Tulsa, Oklahoma. He has traveled the world and stayed in hundreds of hotels and never been in something as bad as this hotel.

Message: Hi there. I recently completed a stay at the Quality Inn Conference Center at Citrus Hills in Hernando, FL. I thought you should know that that property does not take COVID seriously and is putting the safety of their staff and guests at risk. Staff at the front desk rarely wore masks, including when interacting with guests. Even worse, I saw on multiple occasions and on multiple days a housekeeper cleaning guest rooms without a mask. Finally, the hand sanitizer dispensers by the elevator were always empty, indicative of the blas attitude the hotel took to COVID-related safety precautions. I booked that hotel because I believed you guys required masks in your hotels: There were less expensive hotels that were closer to the attractions we wanted to see but I booked a Choice Hotels property because I believed you guys took proper COVID precautions. I rarely complain about anything but I was so disappointed and, frankly, alarmed by what I saw at one of your hotels that I thought you should know so you can hopefully fix the problem. You might safe lives. I really hope you do something about this. Thank you. Thank you, Liz. I hope the owners take your alert seriously.
